steps.headline: Open it in Photoshop.
steps.description: Click 'File' at the top left corner, click 'Open' and browse for your file.

steps.headline: Go to 'Filter' menu at the top.
steps.description:
Select 'Blur' and click 'Smart Blur' in the sub-menu. Set the
Radius to 100
Threshold to 100
Quality to Low
Mode to Normal

steps.headline: At the bottom of the Layers' panel, you will see 7 options.
steps.description: Click option 4 which says 'Create new fill or adjustment layer' if you hover your cursor on it. A sub-menu will pop-up. Click Posterize on it and set the levels to 9 (you can change the settings accordingly). It is always better to make a new adjustment layer since you can delete it if you don't like it.

steps.headline: With the 'History brush' tool, add the tiny details to your oil painting which had become too blurred.
